heaviest_rainfall.status: The most intense rainfall recorded took place on 04 January 2025, with precipitation totalling 36.8mm.  The rain fell at 4.6mm per hour at times over the course of the 37.2 hour storm.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The heaviest rain rate registered stands at 27.0mm per hour on 02 September 2025, highlighting an extreme precipitation event.  21.19mm fell during the storm over 15.0 hours.

longest_rain.status: On 04 January 2025, the rain lasted for 37.2 hours, which is the longest time recorded by our database.  36.8mm accumulated and it fell at 4.6mm per hour at times.

most_lightning.status: The lightning strike count peaked at 23 on 07 September 2025, the highest since recording started on 11 April 2025.

storm.status: An active storm has been detected in the vicinity.  The last storm experienced was on 18 October 2025.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: Currently, the weather is stable with no cold snap in progress.  So far, 6 cold snaps have been recorded this year.  The average yearly count is 3.7.

extreme.status: The largest temperature gap recorded is 26.7°C (0.4 - 27.1°C) on 29 April 2025.

heatwaves.status: There is currently no heatwaves.  This year there have been 6 heatwavess, usually there are 1.9 heatwavess per year.

tropical.status: The last tropical night was recorded on 18 July 2025.  The total number of occurrences since 1973 number is only 62.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (184°), which differs from the daily average south-westerly (231.0°) by approximately 47.0 degrees.    In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: 93.7 mph is the largest wind gust recorded on 13 October 2012.

run.status: The record wind run remains at 1737 miles from 21 October 2012.

speed.status: The top recorded wind speed is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, a bit warmer for the feels like temperature (up 2.2°C) and more moisture-laden outside humidity (up 10%) and rainfall (up 1.1 mm).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in cloud levels (up 684 m).

The past week and month had observable variation in light levels (up 4791 lux), cloud levels (up 661 m), and feels like temperature (down 1.8°C) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 684.1m lower than yesterday, 325.8m lower than the past week, 661.5m lower than the past month.

The cloud levels yesterday fell between 1111m minimum and 2490m maximum, with an average of 928.5m; weekly and monthly averages were marginally higher at 1254.3m and 1589.9m.

summary.summary: Inside; anticipate mild and comfortable temperatures. Outside; mild and pleasant. Also, pleasant humidity levels and winds will be practically absent. Possible light showers, occasional overcast conditions, and light levels will be low during the day. Weather could become unsettled.

washing.phrase: The humidity is too high (96%) for your washing to dry quickly.  Any drying will take longer than usual.
